page.title: 07A W/FISH BOAT_THE"CONTEST"
page.content: The{Contest}is the newest whitefish boat to Whalsay.She has a Kelvin 8 cylinder engine.On the stern of the boat is an Atlas power block for loading and unloading nets.The bow has a set of rope reels and a winch for pulling up the nets.In the wheelhouse she has a skipper 116 colour meter, a skipper 800 paper meter ,2 Furuno radars,an auto pilot, clutch and speed control,steering wheel,2 radio telephones,compass and C B radio.She also has a variable pitch propeller. Built by Forbes of Sandhaven in 1985 the 60' "Contest" is skippered by John G.Anderson;crew-William A.Anderson , John Simpson,Ian Irvine,Robert Leask & John Polson. Sailing after tea on Sunday the boat may be off all week catching haddock , cod and whiting,landing this at Lerwick.Only bad weather stops fishing
